A&E Real Estate is the fourth-largest rental landlord in New York City, with 16,797 units across all five boroughs

Nearly this entire block is owned by A&E Real Estate. Just steps from Columbia’s Morningside campus, many of these buildings were formerly owned by the University, according to property records reviewed by Spectator.

A&E Real Estate Holdings’s portfolio has an average of 1.2 open HPD violations per residential unit. This is worse than the citywide average of 0.8 per residential unit. According to available HPD data, this portfolio has received 56,596 total violations.

Source: Who Owns What

Graphic by Jenny Ye
